snippet.title: Cruise passengers roll in to mark Coast's 50th
snippet.content: THE Sunshine Coast has officially turned 50 today with a number of events planned across the region to celebrate the milestone. They started at Mooloolaba Wharf with the welcoming of about 1800 cruise ship passengers who stepped off P&O's Pacific Jewel for the day. Sunshine Coast Councillor John Connolly and a team of representatives from the council and tourism bodies welcomed the visitors with birthday cake and Coast-branded paraphernalia. Sydney visitor Carole Brown appreciated the welcome and wished the region a happy birthday. "We've never been here before so it is exciting to come to see the place," Ms Brown said. She brought her daughter Melanie and grandson Jackson with her. "I know it is the 50th birthday so congratulations." Cr Jason O'Pray will also host a morning tea to celebrate the 50th anniversary with community groups at Suncare Community Centre Hall in Maroochydore. Cr Connolly said it was great to welcome visitors to the region while marking 50 years since it was named. "We're happy to be sharing celebrations with P&O guests and hope they enjoy the community activities organised for their visit," Cr Connolly said. This is how early you need to be at the airport now.
